bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gustaf E. Lambert, February 27, 1956

div1.p: Hench wants to help Lambert in securing recognition for Lambert and Ames in their yellow fever work.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gustaf E. Lambert, February 27, 1956
div1.opener:
February 27, 1956
Mr. Gust Lambert
17092 Lincoln Street
Hazel Crest, Illinois
My dear Mr. Lambert:
div1.p:
About ten days ago I was called to Washington to testify before a Senate
Committee with respect to the Social Security Act. While there, I had to
visit the Surgeon General's Office. I am a consultant to the Surgeon
General. A young medical officer who knew of my interest in yellow fever
told me that, as he understood it, there was a good chance that Congress
would pass a measure doing what you have been asking them to do for so
long. I know for years you have been fighting hard to obtain recognition
for Doctor Ames and I do hope that you will be successful and of course
in essentially the same category with Ames is yourself.

Is there anything I can do to help in this matter? When do you expect to
hear from Washington? I shall be glad to help in any way possible. Please
use the enclosed envelope for reply.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
